content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 5 to node 1 in the given graph is:

1->2->3 The reason why the path goes through nodes 2 and 3 is because they are the only nodes on the shortest path that are directly connected to node 5. No other nodes on the path have a shorter path to node 1.

The shortest path from node 5 to node 2 in the given graph is:

5->3->4 The shortest path goes through node 3 and then node 4 because they are the only nodes on the shortest path that are directly connected to node 5 and 2 respectively. No other nodes on the path have a shorter path to node 2.
